attributes.action: Provide accommodation to all rough sleepers for this national lockdown.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has not restarted the widely praised Everyone In scheme that helped to house rough sleepers at the start of the pandemic.

Lockdown restrictions have already been enforced, yet the most vulnerable in our country have been left with no help during these challenging times. 

Sign this petition to help support those having to rough sleep during such harsh weather conditions and strict lockdown measures.
attributes.background:
Bring back the Everyone In policy to accommodate rough sleepers during this national lockdown.

The Government were able to do this during the previous lockdown, yet have not done so this time.

During this pandemic, we must do all we can to protect the most vulnerable in our communities.

rejection.details:
The Government announced £310 million of funding to tackle homelessness, to build on the ongoing ‘Everyone In’ campaign. You can find out more here:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-pledges-further-310-million-to-tackle-homelessness

There was a further announcement this month: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/extra-covid-protections-for-rough-sleepers-and-renters

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Fund increased support the homeless: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553237

Require housing for all homeless people after the coronavirus crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311860

End Homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the “Housing First” project: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331268
